newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Father of racing ace Berger gets five years jail.
newsitem.headline: Father of racing ace Berger gets five years jail.

text.p: Johann Berger, father of Formula One racer Gerhard Berger, was sentenced on Tuesday to over five years in jail for his part in swindling millions of marks out of a German bank, Austrian television said.

The 62-year Berger, who used to run a transport firm in Austria's western state Tyrol, was found guilty by the county court in Innsbruck of tricking the Landesgirokasse in Stuttgart out of the sum of 12.6 million marks ($7.5 million) on the pretext of setting up a wood plant in Germany.
Berger's former lawyer, Martin Nagiller, received six years in jail for his part in the scam, while Berger received five years and four months, television said. ($ = 1.690 German Marks)
